title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
echo string: String/Variable output
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo "hello"
hello

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo it is a test
it is a test

text:

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog

hello

it is a test

title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
cd and pwd
pwd: display the current directory cd .: to the current directory cd ..: to its parent directory cd dir_name: to dir_name directory cd ~: to the home cd -: to the last visited directory
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ pwd
/e/blog

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /
$ cd /e/blog
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cd -
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /
$ cd ~
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 ~

title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
ls
ls: display all the content in the current directory ls -l: display the details of content
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls -l
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11æœˆ 20 23:26 _site/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11æœˆ 21 16:54 Missing_Semester/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11æœˆ 14 21:31 posts/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11æœˆ 21 16:49 WEEK_REPORT/

d refers to a directory
rwx: read, write, execute
rwx refers to the owner of the fileâ€™s permissions
r-x refers to the group of the fileâ€™s permissions
r-x refers to anyone elseâ€™s permissions

title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
rmdir and mkdir
rmdir dir_name : Delete empty dirs mkdir dir_name: Building a new directory
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ mkdir 1
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls
_site/  1/  Missing_Semester/  posts/  WEEK_REPORT/
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ rmdir 1
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls
_site/  Missing_Semester/  posts/  WEEK_REPORT/

title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
cat
cat file_nameandcat file1 file2: Displaying file contents cat file1 file2 > combined_file: Redirecting files contents to other file cat > newfile: Reading and saving content from the terminal cat >> existing_file: Appending content to an existing file
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat > main1.py
print("hello")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat > main2.py
print("hao")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat main1.py main2.py
print("hello")
print("hao")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat main1.py main2.py > main.py
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ python main.py
hello
hao

text:
pipe character
|: Using the output of one command as input to another command (Waiting for constructionâ€¦)

title: Missing Semester 1: The Shell
text:
touch
touch file_name: Update the access and modification times of each FILE to the current time.

title: Recognize Handwritten Digits by CNN
text:
A Handwritten Digits Recognition Model based CNN.

Basic Information

Network: CNN
Dataset: MNIST
Framework: Pytorch
GPU: NVIDIA GTX1070





You can download data from MNIST







Code
import cv2
import numpy as np
import torch
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, Dataset
import torch.nn as nn
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from week_log_1.vgg import CNN
import sys
import time
import scipy.io as scio
from IPython.display import Image, display







Code
# Reversing the black and white thresholds for each pixel
def accessPiexl(img):
    height = img.shape[0]
    width = img.shape[1]
    for i in range(height):
       for j in range(width):
           img[i][j] = 255 - img[i][j]
    return img

# Inverse binarized image
def accessBinary(img, threshold=165):
    img = accessPiexl(img)
    kernel = np.ones((3, 3), np.uint8)
    img = cv2.GaussianBlur(img, (3, 3), 0) #Gaussian filter
    img = cv2.erode(img, kernel, iterations=1) #Border burr removal
    # adaptive filter
    img = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(img, 255, cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C, cv2.THRESH_BINARY, 7, -9)
    img = cv2.dilate(img, kernel, iterations=1)
    return img

# For showing prediction results
def showResults(path, borders, results=None):
    img = cv2.imread(path)
    for i, border in enumerate(borders):
        cv2.rectangle(img, border[0], border[1], (0, 0, 255))
        if results:
            cv2.putText(img, str(results[i]), border[0], cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_COMPLEX, 0.8, (0, 255, 0), 1)
    cv2.waitKey(0)
    cv2.imwrite('week_log_1/out.jpg',img)
    display(Image(filename='week_log_1/out.jpg'))

#Search the edge, and return the top right and bottom left coner of the digits
def findBorderContours(path, maxArea=1800):
    img = cv2.imread(path, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
    img = accessBinary(img)
    contours, hierarchy = cv2.findContours(img, cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_NONE)
    borders = []
    for contour in contours:
        #creat a boder
        x, y, w, h = cv2.boundingRect(contour)
        if w*h > maxArea:
            #the coordinate of boder
            border = [(x, y), (x+w, y+h)]
            borders.append(border)
    return borders

def transUSPS(path, borders, size=(28, 28)):
    imgData = np.zeros((len(borders), size[0], size[0], 1), dtype='uint8')
    img = cv2.imread(path, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
    img = accessBinary(img)
    for i, border in enumerate(borders):
        borderImg = img[border[0][1]:border[1][1], border[0][0]:border[1][0]]
        #Expand pixels based on maximum edge make the border close to square
        extendPiexl = (max(borderImg.shape) - min(borderImg.shape)) // 2
        #make border
        targetImg = cv2.copyMakeBorder(borderImg, 7, 7, extendPiexl + 7, extendPiexl + 7, cv2.BORDER_CONSTANT)
        targetImg = cv2.resize(targetImg, size)
        # expand dimension
        targetImg = np.expand_dims(targetImg, axis=-1)
        imgData[i] = targetImg
    return imgData
# load the model and start predicting!

prediction=[]
def predict(modelpath, imgData):
    model = torch.load(modelpath,weights_only=False)
    with torch.no_grad():
        for i, data in enumerate(imgData):
            data = data.type(torch.FloatTensor)
            test_pred = model(data.cuda())
            test_label = np.argmax(test_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1)
            for y in test_label:
                prediction.append(y)







Code
class ImgDataset(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, x, y=None, transform=None):
        self.x = x
        # label is required to be a LongTensor
        self.y = y
        if y is not None:
            self.y = torch.LongTensor(y)
        self.transform = transform
    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.x)
    def __getitem__(self, index):
        X = self.x[index]
        if self.transform is not None:
            X = self.transform(X)
        if self.y is not None:
            Y = self.y[index]
            return X, Y
        else:
            return X







Code
class Classifier(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Classifier, self).__init__()
        # input dimension [1, 16, 16]
        self.vgg = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(1, 16, 3, 1, 1),  # [16, 28, 28]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(16),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(16, 32, 3, 1, 1),  # [32, 28, 28]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(32),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.MaxPool2d(kernel_size=2),  # [32, 14, 14]
            nn.Conv2d(32, 64, 3, 1, 1),  # [64, 14, 14]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(64),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(64, 128, 3, 1, 1),  # [128, 14, 14]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(128),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.MaxPool2d(kernel_size=2),  # [128, 7, 7]
        )
        #model definition
        self.fc = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(128*7*7, 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(p=0.5),
            nn.Linear(512, 1024),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(p=0.5),
            nn.Linear(1024, 11),
        )
#forward propagation
    def forward(self, x):
        out = self.vgg(x)
        out = out.view(out.size()[0], -1)
        return self.fc(out)







Code
print("Reading data")
dataFile2 = 'week_log_1/vgg/data/MNIST.mat'
data2 = scio.loadmat(dataFile2)

train = data2['fea']
train=train.reshape(70000,1,28,28)
label = data2['gnd']
train_x = train[:50000]
train_y = label[:50000]
print("Size of training data = {}".format(len(train_x)))
val_x = train[50000:65000]
val_y = label[50000:65000]
print("Size of validation data = {}".format(len(val_x)))
test_x = train[65000:68000]
test_y = label[65000:68000]
test_y=test_y.reshape(3000)
print("Size of Testing data = {}".format(len(test_x)))
print("reading over")


Reading data
Size of training data = 50000
Size of validation data = 15000
Size of Testing data = 3000
reading over







Code
batch_size = 500
if sys.platform.startswith('win'):
    num_workers = 0  
else:
    num_workers = 4
train_set = ImgDataset(train_x, train_y)
val_set = ImgDataset(val_x, val_y)
train_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(train_set, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True, num_workers=num_workers)
val_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(val_set, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=False,num_workers=num_workers)

train_loss_list=[]
val_loss_list = []
train_acc_list = []
val_acc_list = []

#training
model = CNN.Classifier().cuda()
loss = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()  # loss: CrossEntropyLoss
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=0.001)  # Adam for optimizer
num_epoch = 25
for epoch in range(num_epoch):
    epoch_start_time = time.time()
    train_acc = 0.0
    train_loss = 0.0
    val_acc = 0.0
    val_loss = 0.0
    model.train()
    for i, data in enumerate(train_loader):
        data[0] = data[0].type(torch.FloatTensor)
        data[1]=data[1].reshape(500)
        optimizer.zero_grad()  
        train_pred = model(data[0].cuda())  
        batch_loss = loss(train_pred, data[1].cuda())  
        batch_loss.backward()  
        optimizer.step()  
        train_acc += np.sum(np.argmax(train_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1) == data[1].numpy())
        train_loss += batch_loss.item()
    model.eval()

    with torch.no_grad():
        for i, data in enumerate(val_loader):
            data[0] = data[0].type(torch.FloatTensor)
            data[1] = data[1].reshape(500)
            val_pred = model(data[0].cuda())
            batch_loss = loss(val_pred, data[1].cuda())

            val_acc += np.sum(np.argmax(val_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1) == data[1].numpy())
            val_loss += batch_loss.item()
        if epoch > 20:
            print('[%03d/%03d] %2.2f sec(s) Train Acc: %3.6f Loss: %3.6f | Val Acc: %3.6f loss: %3.6f' % \
              (epoch + 1, num_epoch, time.time() - epoch_start_time, \
               train_acc / train_set.__len__(), train_loss / train_set.__len__(), val_acc / val_set.__len__(),
               val_loss / val_set.__len__()))
        train_loss_list.append(train_loss / train_set.__len__())
        val_loss_list.append(val_loss / val_set.__len__())
        train_acc_list.append(train_acc / train_set.__len__())
        val_acc_list.append(val_acc / val_set.__len__())
torch.save(model,'week_log_1/model.pt')


[022/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.994900 Loss: 0.000032 | Val Acc: 0.992200 loss: 0.000070
[023/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.995180 Loss: 0.000032 | Val Acc: 0.991667 loss: 0.000065
[024/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.996020 Loss: 0.000028 | Val Acc: 0.991333 loss: 0.000070
[025/025] 1.43 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.995480 Loss: 0.000030 | Val Acc: 0.990800 loss: 0.000087






Code
plt.plot(np.arange(num_epoch),train_loss_list)
plt.plot(np.arange(num_epoch),val_loss_list)
plt.xlabel("Epoch")
plt.ylabel("Loss")
plt.show()

plt.plot(np.arange(num_epoch),train_acc_list)
plt.plot(np.arange(num_epoch),val_acc_list)
plt.xlabel("Epoch")
plt.ylabel("accuracy")
plt.show()










FigureÂ 1: loss











FigureÂ 2: accuracy












Code
path = 'week_log_1/vgg/data/2.jpg'
model = 'week_log_1/model.pt'
borders = findBorderContours(path)

imgData = transUSPS(path, borders)
imgData = np.transpose(imgData,[0,3,1,2])
imgData = ImgDataset(imgData)
test_loader = DataLoader(imgData, batch_size=1, shuffle=False)
results = predict(model, test_loader)
showResults(path, borders, prediction)

title: Recognize Handwritten Digits by CNN
text:
A Handwritten Digits Recognition Model based CNN.

Basic Information

Network: CNN
Dataset: MNIST
Framework: Pytorch
GPU: NVIDIA GTX1070

title: Recognize Handwritten Digits by CNN
text: You can download data from MNIST

title: Recognize Handwritten Digits by CNN
text:
Code
import cv2
import numpy as np
import torch
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, Dataset
import torch.nn as nn
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from week_log_1.vgg import CNN
import sys
import time
import scipy.io as scio
from IPython.display import Image, display







Code
# Reversing the black and white thresholds for each pixel
def accessPiexl(img):
    height = img.shape[0]
    width = img.shape[1]
    for i in range(height):
       for j in range(width):
           img[i][j] = 255 - img[i][j]
    return img

# Inverse binarized image
def accessBinary(img, threshold=165):
    img = accessPiexl(img)
    kernel = np.ones((3, 3), np.uint8)
    img = cv2.GaussianBlur(img, (3, 3), 0) #Gaussian filter
    img = cv2.erode(img, kernel, iterations=1) #Border burr removal
    # adaptive filter
    img = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(img, 255, cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C, cv2.THRESH_BINARY, 7, -9)
    img = cv2.dilate(img, kernel, iterations=1)
    return img

# For showing prediction results
def showResults(path, borders, results=None):
    img = cv2.imread(path)
    for i, border in enumerate(borders):
        cv2.rectangle(img, border[0], border[1], (0, 0, 255))
        if results:
            cv2.putText(img, str(results[i]), border[0], cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_COMPLEX, 0.8, (0, 255, 0), 1)
    cv2.waitKey(0)
    cv2.imwrite('week_log_1/out.jpg',img)
    display(Image(filename='week_log_1/out.jpg'))

#Search the edge, and return the top right and bottom left coner of the digits
def findBorderContours(path, maxArea=1800):
    img = cv2.imread(path, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
    img = accessBinary(img)
    contours, hierarchy = cv2.findContours(img, cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_NONE)
    borders = []
    for contour in contours:
        #creat a boder
        x, y, w, h = cv2.boundingRect(contour)
        if w*h > maxArea:
            #the coordinate of boder
            border = [(x, y), (x+w, y+h)]
            borders.append(border)
    return borders

def transUSPS(path, borders, size=(28, 28)):
    imgData = np.zeros((len(borders), size[0], size[0], 1), dtype='uint8')
    img = cv2.imread(path, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
    img = accessBinary(img)
    for i, border in enumerate(borders):
        borderImg = img[border[0][1]:border[1][1], border[0][0]:border[1][0]]
        #Expand pixels based on maximum edge make the border close to square
        extendPiexl = (max(borderImg.shape) - min(borderImg.shape)) // 2
        #make border
        targetImg = cv2.copyMakeBorder(borderImg, 7, 7, extendPiexl + 7, extendPiexl + 7, cv2.BORDER_CONSTANT)
        targetImg = cv2.resize(targetImg, size)
        # expand dimension
        targetImg = np.expand_dims(targetImg, axis=-1)
        imgData[i] = targetImg
    return imgData
# load the model and start predicting!

prediction=[]
def predict(modelpath, imgData):
    model = torch.load(modelpath,weights_only=False)
    with torch.no_grad():
        for i, data in enumerate(imgData):
            data = data.type(torch.FloatTensor)
            test_pred = model(data.cuda())
            test_label = np.argmax(test_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1)
            for y in test_label:
                prediction.append(y)







Code
class ImgDataset(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, x, y=None, transform=None):
        self.x = x
        # label is required to be a LongTensor
        self.y = y
        if y is not None:
            self.y = torch.LongTensor(y)
        self.transform = transform
    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.x)
    def __getitem__(self, index):
        X = self.x[index]
        if self.transform is not None:
            X = self.transform(X)
        if self.y is not None:
            Y = self.y[index]
            return X, Y
        else:
            return X







Code
class Classifier(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Classifier, self).__init__()
        # input dimension [1, 16, 16]
        self.vgg = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(1, 16, 3, 1, 1),  # [16, 28, 28]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(16),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(16, 32, 3, 1, 1),  # [32, 28, 28]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(32),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.MaxPool2d(kernel_size=2),  # [32, 14, 14]
            nn.Conv2d(32, 64, 3, 1, 1),  # [64, 14, 14]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(64),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(64, 128, 3, 1, 1),  # [128, 14, 14]
            nn.BatchNorm2d(128),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.MaxPool2d(kernel_size=2),  # [128, 7, 7]
        )
        #model definition
        self.fc = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(128*7*7, 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(p=0.5),
            nn.Linear(512, 1024),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(p=0.5),
            nn.Linear(1024, 11),
        )
#forward propagation
    def forward(self, x):
        out = self.vgg(x)
        out = out.view(out.size()[0], -1)
        return self.fc(out)







Code
print("Reading data")
dataFile2 = 'week_log_1/vgg/data/MNIST.mat'
data2 = scio.loadmat(dataFile2)

train = data2['fea']
train=train.reshape(70000,1,28,28)
label = data2['gnd']
train_x = train[:50000]
train_y = label[:50000]
print("Size of training data = {}".format(len(train_x)))
val_x = train[50000:65000]
val_y = label[50000:65000]
print("Size of validation data = {}".format(len(val_x)))
test_x = train[65000:68000]
test_y = label[65000:68000]
test_y=test_y.reshape(3000)
print("Size of Testing data = {}".format(len(test_x)))
print("reading over")


Reading data
Size of training data = 50000
Size of validation data = 15000
Size of Testing data = 3000
reading over







Code
batch_size = 500
if sys.platform.startswith('win'):
    num_workers = 0  
else:
    num_workers = 4
train_set = ImgDataset(train_x, train_y)
val_set = ImgDataset(val_x, val_y)
train_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(train_set, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True, num_workers=num_workers)
val_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(val_set, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=False,num_workers=num_workers)

train_loss_list=[]
val_loss_list = []
train_acc_list = []
val_acc_list = []

#training
model = CNN.Classifier().cuda()
loss = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()  # loss: CrossEntropyLoss
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=0.001)  # Adam for optimizer
num_epoch = 25
for epoch in range(num_epoch):
    epoch_start_time = time.time()
    train_acc = 0.0
    train_loss = 0.0
    val_acc = 0.0
    val_loss = 0.0
    model.train()
    for i, data in enumerate(train_loader):
        data[0] = data[0].type(torch.FloatTensor)
        data[1]=data[1].reshape(500)
        optimizer.zero_grad()  
        train_pred = model(data[0].cuda())  
        batch_loss = loss(train_pred, data[1].cuda())  
        batch_loss.backward()  
        optimizer.step()  
        train_acc += np.sum(np.argmax(train_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1) == data[1].numpy())
        train_loss += batch_loss.item()
    model.eval()

    with torch.no_grad():
        for i, data in enumerate(val_loader):
            data[0] = data[0].type(torch.FloatTensor)
            data[1] = data[1].reshape(500)
            val_pred = model(data[0].cuda())
            batch_loss = loss(val_pred, data[1].cuda())

            val_acc += np.sum(np.argmax(val_pred.cpu().data.numpy(), axis=1) == data[1].numpy())
            val_loss += batch_loss.item()
        if epoch > 20:
            print('[%03d/%03d] %2.2f sec(s) Train Acc: %3.6f Loss: %3.6f | Val Acc: %3.6f loss: %3.6f' % \
              (epoch + 1, num_epoch, time.time() - epoch_start_time, \
               train_acc / train_set.__len__(), train_loss / train_set.__len__(), val_acc / val_set.__len__(),
               val_loss / val_set.__len__()))
        train_loss_list.append(train_loss / train_set.__len__())
        val_loss_list.append(val_loss / val_set.__len__())
        train_acc_list.append(train_acc / train_set.__len__())
        val_acc_list.append(val_acc / val_set.__len__())
torch.save(model,'week_log_1/model.pt')


[022/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.994900 Loss: 0.000032 | Val Acc: 0.992200 loss: 0.000070
[023/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.995180 Loss: 0.000032 | Val Acc: 0.991667 loss: 0.000065
[024/025] 1.42 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.996020 Loss: 0.000028 | Val Acc: 0.991333 loss: 0.000070
[025/025] 1.43 sec(s) Train Acc: 0.995480 Loss: 0.000030 | Val Acc: 0.990800 loss: 0.000087

path = 'week_log_1/vgg/data/2.jpg'
model = 'week_log_1/model.pt'
borders = findBorderContours(path)

imgData = transUSPS(path, borders)
imgData = np.transpose(imgData,[0,3,1,2])
imgData = ImgDataset(imgData)
test_loader = DataLoader(imgData, batch_size=1, shuffle=False)
results = predict(model, test_loader)
showResults(path, borders, prediction)

title: Missing Semester 2: Shell Tools and Scripting
text:
Contents in '(string)' are literal strings
Contents in "(string)" are substituted by variable values.
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ foo=bar

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo '$foo'
$foo

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo "$foo"
bar

Contents in "(string)" are substituted by variable values.
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog

title: Missing Semester 2: Shell Tools and Scripting
section: script function, source loading and execution
text:
script function, source loading and execution
mcd () {
     mkdir -p "$1"
     cd "$1"
 }

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ source mcd.sh

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ mcd test
source executes the commands in the corresponding file.
mcd test: Create a folder and switch to it.

title: Missing Semester 2: Shell Tools and Scripting
text:
bash arguments
$0: Name of the script.
$1-9: The first through ninth arguments of the function.
$@: All the arguments
$#: Number of arguments
$?: Return code of the previous command
wuhao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ ls
test1/  test2/

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ cd test3

# Returns 1 if the previous command failed
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ echo $?
1

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ mkdir test3

# Returns 0 if the previous command succeeded
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ echo $?
0
!!: Entire last command.
$ mkdir /usr/test
Permission denied

$ sudo !!
sudo mkdir /usr/test
$_: Last argument from the last command.
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ mkdir test1

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test
$ cd $_

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog/test/test1
||: or operator; &&: and operator; ;: separate commands
# A example contains all above command
echo "Starting program at $(date)" # Date will be substituted

echo "Running program $0 with $# arguments with pid $$"

for file in "$@"; do
    grep foobar "$file" > /dev/null 2> /dev/null
    # When pattern is not found, grep has exit status 1
    # We redirect STDOUT and STDERR to a null register since we do not care about them
    if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo "File $file does not have any foobar, adding one"
        echo "# foobar" >> "$file"
    fi
done

Results:
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ./example.sh mcd.sh test2.sh
Starting program at 2024å¹´12æœˆ13æ—¥  16:34:41
Running program ./example.sh with 2 arguments with pid 2115
File mcd.sh does not have any foobar, adding one
File test2.sh does not have any foobar, adding one
